intro: Teramnus volubilis, commonly known as the climbing teramnus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Teramnus volubilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
